meanings.definition: Deprives of the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: The new law disfranchises many citizens.
meanings.sent2: Being underage disfranchises individuals from voting.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a scene if a cat disfranchised all the dogs from voting!
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain disfranchises the plants from getting sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The dark cloud of corruption disfranchises the people from their voice in the government.

meanings.definition: Excludes from a privilege or right.
meanings.sent1: The strict rules disfranchise some students from participating.
meanings.sent2: His behavior disfranchises him from attending the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick disfranchised the rabbit from the hat!
meanings.sent4: The high cost of living disfranchises many from owning a home.
meanings.sent5: The locked gate disfranchises visitors from entering the garden.
